intro: Fagara harmsiana, commonly known as the Jamaican evergreen or mountain pepper, is a member of the Rubiaceae family. It is a shrub or small tree native to the Caribbean, particularly Jamaica and parts of Central America. The plant is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and clusters of small, white flowers that bloom in the summer. Its fruits are small, round berries that turn red when mature, and it is sometimes used in traditional medicine. The plant's ornamental value and ecological importance make it a notable species in its native habitat.
